title: 103_hr1816
content: The "Stripper Well Operators Preservation Act of 1993" increases the percentage depletion for oil and natural gas produced from stripper well properties. The amendment changes the percentages and dollar amounts in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The net income limitation on percentage depletion is repealed for stripper well properties. The amendment to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 increases the percentage depletion for oil and gas properties, with a limit of 50% for stripper well properties. The amendment also includes a conforming amendment and is effective for taxable years after the enactment of the Act. SEC. 4. EXPANSION OF ENHANCED OIL RECOVERY CREDIT. Section 43(a) of the Internal Revenue Code is amended to increase the enhanced oil recovery credit to 15 percent of qualified enhanced oil recovery costs for any taxable year. Additionally, 15 percent of stripper well production costs is included for taxpayers other than integrated oil companies. The term 'Stripper Well Production costs' refers to expenses for tangible and intangible property integral to a qualified stripper well recovery project, allowing for depreciation or amortization. The term 'qualified stripper well recovery project' refers to a project involving a stripper well property and the application of approved recovery methods. A qualified stripper well recovery project involves applying approved recovery methods to prolong the productive life of the well and increase crude oil recovery, located within the United States. The operator must submit a certification to the Secretary to confirm the project meets the requirements. The amendment prohibits double certification for qualified enhanced oil recovery and stripper well recovery projects under the Code. Additionally, a conforming amendment includes qualified stripper well recovery costs in the section. The amendment includes qualified stripper well recovery costs in the section for taxable years beginning after the date of enactment of this Act.
